title: Longest Palindromic Substring
description: Given a string s, return the longest palindromic substring in s.
constraints: s consists of only digits and English letters.

brute-force.name: Brute Force
brute-force.description: Check palindrome expanding from each character.

steps.instruction: Define the function longest_palindrome that takes s.

steps.hint: Initialize variables to store the longest palindrome found so far.
Iterate through each character in the string, treating it as the center of a potential palindrome.

steps.placeholderCode:
l, r = i, i
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1
steps.hint: Expand outwards from single character center (odd length). Update max length if found.
steps.solutionCode:
l, r = i, i
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1

steps.placeholderCode:
l, r = i, i + 1
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1
steps.hint: Expand outwards from between characters (even length). Update max length if found.
steps.solutionCode:
l, r = i, i + 1
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1

steps.hint: Return the longest palindrome string found.

optimal.name: Optimal
optimal.description: Same as brute force, O(n^2) time and O(1) space.

steps.instruction: Define the function longest_palindrome that takes s.
Initialize the result string as empty.
steps.hint: This variable will store the actual palindromic substring.

steps.instruction: Initialize the length of the longest palindrome found to zero.
steps.hint: Use this to track and compare the lengths of various centered palindromes.

steps.instruction: Iterate through each character in the string, treating it as a potential center.
steps.hint: Every character (or space between) can be the center of a palindrome.

steps.instruction: Expand outwards for odd-length palindromes centered at index 'i'.
steps.placeholderCode:
l, r = i, i
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1
steps.hint: Check palindromes like 'aba' where 'b' is the center.
steps.solutionCode:
l, r = i, i
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1

steps.instruction: Expand outwards for even-length palindromes centered between index 'i' and 'i+1'.
steps.placeholderCode:
l, r = i, i + 1
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1
steps.hint: Check palindromes like 'abba' where the center is between the 'b's.
steps.solutionCode:
l, r = i, i + 1
        while l >= 0 and r < len(s) and s[l] == s[r]:
            if (r - l + 1) > resLen:
                res = s[l:r+1]
                resLen = r - l + 1
            l -= 1
            r += 1

steps.instruction: Return the final result string representing the longest palindrome found.
steps.hint: The answer is finally stored in 'res'.
